För att lyssna på en mp3 i en delvis hämtad torrent (med BitTornado) klicka på details och sedan Finish Allocation (tar ett bra tag med större torrents). Detta får alla bitarna att läggas på rätt plats och låten spelas upp ok.

I don't know it there was a solution to the "[error24] too many open files" problem, but here is my workaround. 
The problem is that linux shells have a limit to how many files can be opened at the same time (my debian: 1024). that limit can be changed with uname -n 16384, setting the limit to 16384. unfortunately that only works for the current session, and only root can do that. 
So here is the workaround. The bt client only needs to open all the 2545 files one time: at creation. So what you do is: Change to root user, start the torrent. After allocation is complete, exit the bt client and chown (chown -R username:username xmas/) the allocated files to the user. Now you can go back to the user and the download can start.
